availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Absalom B. Ford (Owen County laborer, farmer, and soldier)

body.p: Owen County, Kentucky, laborer, soldier, and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Benjamin Ford and Nancy Ford. Married to Elizabeth A. Green Ford in Owen County, Kentucky, on June 16, 1858. Father of Clarrence G. Ford. Laborer in Owen County in 1850. Household owned seventeen enslaved persons in Owen County in 1850. Served in the Regiment of Mounted Riflemen (U.S.A.) from October 6, 1851 to September 5, 1852. Reported as having deserted on September 5, 1852. Farmer in Owen County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Owen County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 1, p. 250B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 1, p. 3.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 1, p. 413.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 1, p. 175A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film #000272774, p. 528.
Registers of Enlistments in the United States Army, 1798-1914, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M233.
